column4: when i have made the update form 9.10 to 10.04 i have had a bug which made the update incomplete what i need an advice should i rollback or i wait to solve the bug
i can't remove or add pkg and i can't update the ditro
How did you do the update? LiveCD or through update-manager?
There have been quiote a few issues i know of where upgrading via update-manager has caused errors. I would have said the easiest option is to roll back and use a LiveCD if possible
What are you trying to upgrade to? and what from? 9.10 -> 10.04 ??
Then roll back and burn the 10.04 liveCD and upgrade using that.
It seems there's no direct rollback functionality. (Correct me anyone if i'm wrong here!) The only thing i can suggest is back up all your files and do a clean install from a 10.04 liveCD.
thanks too much for your help , after a backup i will do that
is rollback functionality available for older distros
is the roll back function avilable for 9.04 or 9.10 juste to know if i could wait for till it will be available
I've no idea. I didn't realise there was a specific rollback function at all.
thanks too much your help was very important for me :) thanks
